crypto_game.title: Cryptography Game
crypto_game.description: Visual/puzzle game inspired by the article Cryptris I from CNRS. It combines ternary encryption with graphical block manipulation to reveal a hidden message.

screenshots.description:
Demo video of my cryptography minigame:
1. The player chooses the size of the word to be encrypted
2. The player enters a word
3. The word is converted into a ternary code: each letter is mapped to a sequence of 4 ‚Äútrits‚Äù (values in {-1,0,+1}) according to a predefined table
4. A secret key is randomly generated, influencing the form, position, and weight of displayed blocks
5. The encrypted message is obtained by combining the ternary code with the key (rotations, sums, multiplications, etc.)
6. The game board shows two block sets: key blocks on top, encrypted message blocks on bottom
7. The player manipulates blocks (horizontal moves, color change, drop, etc.) to align the encrypted message
8. End condition is reached when all encrypted elements are reduced to one of the simple states (-1,0,+1)
